properties.areaDesc: Santa Fe Metro Area; Estancia Valley; Middle Rio Grande Valley/Albuquerque Metro Area; Sandia/Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood; Espanola Valley; Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 4 at 2:19PM MST until February 4 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque NM
properties.description:
...MORE SNOW EXPECTED FOR CENTRAL AND EASTERN NEW MEXICO...

.A storm system has delivered wintry weather to much of central
and eastern New Mexico through at least this evening. Eight to 10
inches of snowfall will occur across the mountain peaks and west
facing slopes while around 2 to 6 inches will fall in the high
valleys, eastern highlands and plains. Temperatures will stay
below freezing today which will cause roadways to become icy and
snowpacked, including along the I-25 corridor from Santa Fe to
Raton Pass as well as other mountain passes and I-40 from the east
mountain communities to the Texas border.

* WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to 2 inches.
Most of the accumulating snow in the Albuquerque Metro will be
in the eastern foothills.

* WHERE...Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass, Espanola
Valley, Santa Fe Metro Area, Middle Rio Grande Valley
including the Albuquerque Metro Area, Sandia and Manzano
Mountains including Edgewood and Estancia Valley.

* WHEN...Until 8 PM MST this evening.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The combination of falling and blowing snow
will reduce visibility below 1 mile.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for New Mexico can be obtained by
calling 5 1 1, 1-800-432-4269, or visiting nmroads.com.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MST THIS EVENING
